section.title: &eyedb; databases architecture

listitem.para: a database is composed of dataspaces (at least one) and each dataspace is composed of datafiles.
a datafile is a physical file while a dataspace is a logical unit used to gather datafiles.

section.para:
When you create a database with no options:
a datafile named DEFAULT, whose file is DBNAME.dat, and size is 2Gb is automatically created
a dataspace named DEFAULT is automatically created, this dataspace contains the previous datafile
Then you can add datafiles and dataspaces at any time as follows:

example.title: &eyedbadmin; datafile create
example.screen: # creating 4 datafiles 300Gb size eyedbadmin datafile create --size=300000 foo foo0.dat eyedbadmin datafile create --size=300000 foo foo1.dat eyedbadmin datafile create --size=300000 foo foo2.dat eyedbadmin datafile create --size=300000 foo foo3.dat

example.title: &eyedbadmin; dataspace create
example.screen: # creating a dataspace gathering those 4 datafiles eyedbadmin dataspace create foo DSP1 1 2 3

You can also resize existing datafiles, move them, delete them (if they contains no data) and update dataspaces.

section.title: Creating and deleting datafiles
section.para:
Creating a datafile is done using the &eyedbadmin; command:
&eyedbadmin; datafile create options database datafile

Options are:
--filedir=directory
option comment
--name=name
option comment
--size=size
option comment
--slotsize=slotsize
option comment
--physical
option comment

Command arguments are:
database
the database to which the datafile will be attached
datafile
the datafile name (.dat file name extension is recommended)
